p: Triterpenes and especially pentacyclic triterpenes form a significant part of bioactive substances of apple [ 63, 64]. These mainly include triterpenic acid, ursolic acid, 2α-hydroxy Ursan, 3β, 20β-hydroxy Ursan-28-oic acid, oleanolic acid, 2α-hydroxy oleanolic, betulinic, 3-O-p-coumaroyl 3-O-p-kumaroyl torment, and other [ 65], or 3β-trans-cinnamoyl oxy-2α-hydroxy-urs-12-en-28-oic, which is one of the main components of the apple peel [ 66] ( Table 5; Figure 4).
